known as ‘after pains’. These are 
both because feeding causes 
the uterus to contract.
Gradually, the discharge will 
become a brownish colour and 
may continue for some weeks, 
getting less and less until it 
stops.	If	you	find	you	are	losing	
blood in large clots or notice 
an	offensive	odour,	you	should	
save your sanitary towels to 
show the midwife as you may 
need some treatment.
Sex and contraception
Soon after your baby is born, 
a midwife or doctor will talk to 
you about contraceptio
